title: Joshua Chapter 21 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Joshua chapter 21 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Joshua Chapter 21 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Joshua Chapter 21.

questions.question: Who came near to Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun in Joshua 21?
options: The heads of the fathers of the Levites
questions.correctAnswer: The heads of the fathers of the Levites
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:1 states that the heads of the fathers of the Levites came near to Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun.

questions.question: Where did the Levites speak to Joshua and Eleazar about their cities to dwell in?
options: At Shiloh in the land of Canaan
questions.correctAnswer: At Shiloh in the land of Canaan
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:2 says they spoke to them at Shiloh in the land of Canaan about the cities God commanded to be given.

questions.question: Who gave cities and their suburbs to the Levites according to Joshua 21?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:3 states that the children of Israel gave cities and their suburbs to the Levites as the LORD commanded.

questions.question: How many cities were given by lot to the children of Aaron from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:4 states the children of Aaron had thirteen cities by lot out of the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.

questions.question: Which tribe did the remaining children of Kohath receive cities from, apart from Aaron's family?
options: Ephraim, Dan, and half tribe of Manasseh
questions.correctAnswer: Ephraim, Dan, and half tribe of Manasseh
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:5 mentions the rest of the children of Kohath had cities by lot from the tribes of Ephraim, Dan, and half tribe of Manasseh.

questions.question: Which city given to the children of Aaron was also known as the city of Arba?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:11 identifies the city of Arba as Hebron, given to the children of Aaron.

questions.question: Who received the fields and villages of Hebron as a possession?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:12 states that the fields of the city and villages were given to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.

questions.question: How many cities did the children of Gershon receive, according to Joshua 21?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:33 records that the children of Gershon received thirteen cities with their suburbs.

questions.question: Which city given to the children of Kohath was designated as a city of refuge in mount Ephraim?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:21 states Shechem in mount Ephraim was given to the Kohathites as a city of refuge for the slayer.

questions.question: How many cities in total were given to the Levites with their suburbs?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:41 states that all the cities of the Levites were forty and eight with their suburbs.

questions.question: True or False: According to Joshua 21, the LORD delivered all the enemies of Israel into their hand.
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:44 states that the LORD delivered all their enemies into their hand, giving them rest round about.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Merari received ten cities by lot according to Joshua 21.
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:40 says the children of Merari received twelve cities by lot, not ten.

questions.question: True or False: Joshua 21 records that the LORD gave Israel rest according to all that He swore to their fathers.
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:44 confirms that the LORD gave Israel rest according to all His promises to their fathers.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Joshua 21:13: 'Thus they gave to the children of Aaron the priest Hebron with her suburbs, to be a city of refuge for the ______; and Libnah with her suburbs,'
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:13 states that Hebron was given to be a city of refuge for the slayer.

questions.question: Which tribe provided the city of Golan in Bashan to the children of Gershon?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:27 records that Golan in Bashan was given to the children of Gershon from the half tribe of Manasseh.

medium.title: Joshua Chapter 21 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Joshua Chapter 21 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with contentment in their place of service in the church. Based on Joshua 21, what biblical truth would you share about being content and faithful in one's assigned role?
options: God provides specific places for each to serve and blesses faithfulness within those roles
One must seek a higher position to be truly blessed
Service in the church is only for the most talented
Only large cities are worthy places to serve
questions.correctAnswer: God provides specific places for each to serve and blesses faithfulness within those roles
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:1-4 and Joshua 21:41-42 show how God assigned specific cities to the Levites by lot, indicating His providence and care in placing His servants. This teaches contentment and faithfulness in the role God gives.

questions.question: How does Joshua 21 teach us about stewardship and generosity in a community setting?
options: The Israelites gave cities from their inheritance to the Levites as God commanded
Each tribe kept all their possessions without sharing
Only the priests received any inheritance
Levites had to buy their cities from other tribes
questions.correctAnswer: The Israelites gave cities from their inheritance to the Levites as God commanded
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:2-3 and Joshua 21:8 explain that the children of Israel gave cities to the Levites according to the LORD’s command through Moses, demonstrating obedience and generosity in stewardship.

questions.question: A believer is questioning God's provision during difficult times. Based on Joshua 21:43-45, what encouragement can be found about God's faithfulness?
options: God fulfilled all His promises and gave rest, delivering enemies into their hands
God only helps if people are perfect
questions.correctAnswer: God fulfilled all His promises and gave rest, delivering enemies into their hands
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:43-45 declares that God gave Israel all the land promised, provided rest, and delivered their enemies, showing His unwavering faithfulness to His word.

questions.question: How does Joshua 21 illustrate the importance of obedience to God's commands in church leadership and service?
options: The Levites received cities by lot as commanded by God through Moses
The Levites chose their cities freely without guidance
The leaders ignored God's commands about inheritance
Cities were assigned based on popularity
questions.correctAnswer: The Levites received cities by lot as commanded by God through Moses
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:4-8 highlights that the Levites received cities according to the LORD's command by Moses, emphasizing obedience and submission to God's instructions in leadership roles.

questions.question: A believer is feeling discouraged about their spiritual gifts and service impact. What does Joshua 21 teach about serving God faithfully regardless of scale or status?
options: Every Levite family was given cities to dwell in, showing God values all service
Only Aaron’s family was honored with cities
Only the largest tribes received blessings
Service is only meaningful if publicly recognized
questions.correctAnswer: Every Levite family was given cities to dwell in, showing God values all service
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:20-40 shows cities were allotted to all Levite families – Kohathites, Gershonites, and Merarites – highlighting God's recognition of faithful service in diverse roles.

questions.question: What does Joshua 21 teach about the importance of prayer and dependence on God in receiving blessings and provision?
options: God gave cities to the Levites as He promised, showing blessings come from Him
The Levites earned cities by their own strength
Blessings come from human effort alone
Provision is based on political power
questions.correctAnswer: God gave cities to the Levites as He promised, showing blessings come from Him
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:43-45 confirms that the land and cities came by God's promise and power, encouraging reliance on Him through prayer and faith.

questions.question: True or False: According to Joshua 21, the Levites were given cities only within one tribe's territory.
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:4-7 and 21:20-40 describe Levites receiving cities from multiple tribes including Judah, Simeon, Benjamin, Ephraim, Dan, Manasseh, Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.

questions.question: True or False: The cities given to the Levites had suburbs for their cattle and other needs.
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:2 and Joshua 21:3 explain that the LORD commanded giving cities with their suburbs for the Levites to dwell in and care for their cattle, indicating provision for their livelihood.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with forgiveness and reconciliation in the church. How can the assignment of cities as described in Joshua 21 encourage humility and unity among God’s people?
options: God assigned cities by lot to ensure fairness and prevent jealousy
Cities were given to those who demanded them
The Levites competed fiercely for the best cities
questions.correctAnswer: God assigned cities by lot to ensure fairness and prevent jealousy
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:4-8 describes how the Levites received cities by lot, teaching humility, fairness, and unity by trusting God's just provision rather than human rivalry.

questions.question: How does Joshua 21 teach about perseverance through trials and trusting God's promises?
options: God’s promises were fulfilled despite challenges, giving rest and victory
The Israelites failed to possess the land fully
questions.correctAnswer: God’s promises were fulfilled despite challenges, giving rest and victory
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:43-45 shows that God gave Israel rest and victory over enemies, assuring believers to persevere trusting His faithfulness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Joshua 21 teaches that the Levites were given cities with ________ for their livestock and families.
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:2 and Joshua 21:3 mention that the Levites were given cities with suburbs for their cattle and families, showing God’s provision.

questions.question: According to Joshua 21, how does God’s provision in assigning cities relate to integrity and honesty in daily life?
options: God’s command was followed exactly, showing obedience and honesty in distributing inheritance
People took more than their share
Some Levites were cheated out of cities
questions.correctAnswer: God’s command was followed exactly, showing obedience and honesty in distributing inheritance
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:8 and Joshua 21:41 describe how the Israelites gave cities to the Levites exactly as the LORD commanded through Moses, reflecting integrity and obedience.

questions.question: How does Joshua 21 instruct believers about humility and gratitude in receiving God’s blessings?
options: All blessings, including cities, came as God’s gracious gift, not by human merit
Gratitude is optional in receiving blessings
questions.correctAnswer: All blessings, including cities, came as God’s gracious gift, not by human merit
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:43-45 emphasizes God’s faithfulness in giving land and cities, teaching humility and gratitude for His gracious provision.

questions.question: A believer is seeking guidance on serving others in church life. What does Joshua 21 teach about serving others within God’s appointed place and role?
options: Each Levite family served in the cities God assigned, fulfilling their role faithfully
Only priests served in the cities
Levites served only in the tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: Each Levite family served in the cities God assigned, fulfilling their role faithfully
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:20-40 shows various Levite families received specific cities to serve in, illustrating faithful service in God’s appointed roles and places.

questions.question: What biblical truth about God's faithfulness and the fulfillment of His promises can you share with someone discouraged by unmet goals, based on Joshua 21?
options: God fulfilled every promise to Israel, giving them rest and victory
Promises depend on human effort only
questions.correctAnswer: God fulfilled every promise to Israel, giving them rest and victory
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:43-45 highlights God's complete fulfillment of promises to Israel, encouraging trust in His timing and faithfulness.

hard.title: Joshua Chapter 21 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Joshua Chapter 21.

questions.question: Which priest was present alongside Joshua when the heads of the Levite families came near to receive their cities?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:1 mentions that the heads of the Levite families came near to Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun.

questions.question: Where did the Levites speak to Joshua and Eleazar about the cities they were to receive?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:2 states that the Levites spoke to Joshua and Eleazar at Shiloh in the land of Canaan.

questions.question: The giving of cities to the Levites was commanded by whom, according to Joshua 21?
options: The LORD by the hand of Moses
Joshua by the command of God
Eleazar by the counsel of elders
The tribes of Israel by consensus
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD by the hand of Moses
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:2 and 21:3 make clear that the LORD commanded by the hand of Moses to give cities to the Levites.

questions.question: How many cities were allotted to the children of Aaron from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin combined?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:4 specifies that the children of Aaron had by lot thirteen cities from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin.

questions.question: Which family of the Levites received cities from the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and the half tribe of Manasseh in Bashan?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:6 states that the children of Gershon had cities from Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and the half tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.

questions.question: True or False: The tribe of Dan gave cities to the children of Merari.
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:23-24 shows that the tribe of Dan gave cities to the children of Kohath, not Merari.

questions.question: Which city, formerly called Arba's city, was given to the children of Aaron and designated as a city of refuge?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:11 and 21:13 state that Hebron, the city of Arba, was given to the children of Aaron as a city of refuge.

questions.question: Caleb received possession of what specific part related to Hebron?
options: Fields and villages of the city
questions.correctAnswer: Fields and villages of the city
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:12 clarifies that Caleb received the fields and villages of Hebron as his possession, distinct from the Levites’ city allotment.

questions.question: How many total cities with their suburbs were given to the Levites in all?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:41 records that the total cities given to the Levites were forty-eight with their suburbs.

questions.question: Which city given to the Kohathites was also designated as a city of refuge and located in mount Ephraim?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:21 indicates Shechem in mount Ephraim was given to the Kohathites and was a city of refuge.

questions.question: The Levite family of Merari received cities from which of the following tribes?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:34-39 lists cities given to the Merarites from Zebulun, Reuben, and Gad.

questions.question: Which city given to the Gershonites was located in Bashan and served as a city of refuge?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:27 states that Golan in Bashan was given to the Gershonites as a city of refuge.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Joshua 21, the LORD gave Israel all the land which He had _______ to their fathers.
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:43 says the LORD gave Israel all the land which He had sworn to give their fathers, emphasizing the covenantal promise.

questions.question: Which theme is strongly emphasized in the conclusion of Joshua 21, showing the fulfillment of God's promises to Israel?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:44-45 highlights that the LORD gave Israel rest and fulfilled all His promises, underscoring divine faithfulness.

questions.question: True or False: The cities given to the Levites served only as places for their residence and had no special legal or religious significance.
questions.explanation: Joshua 21 specifies that some cities were designated as cities of refuge, showing their special legal and religious role.

theological.title: Joshua Chapter 21 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Joshua Chapter 21 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the primary reason the Levites came to Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun at Shiloh?
options: To request cities to dwell in as commanded by the LORD through Moses
To ask for more land for farming
To appoint new priests among their families
questions.correctAnswer: To request cities to dwell in as commanded by the LORD through Moses
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:1-2 shows the Levite heads approaching Eleazar and Joshua to remind them of the Lord's command through Moses to give them cities with suburbs for their cattle. This highlights God's provision and faithfulness in fulfilling His covenant promises. Similar provision for the priestly tribe is seen in Numbers 35:1-8; Deuteronomy 10:8-9; and in the New Testament, Hebrews 7:11-14 shows the priestly role fulfilled in Christ.

questions.question: How many cities were given to the children of Aaron, the priests, according to their lot?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:4-19 outlines that the children of Aaron, part of the Kohathite family, received thirteen cities by lot from the tribes of Judah, Simeon, and Benjamin. This distribution underscores God's orderly provision for the priestly tribe, reflecting His justice and faithfulness. References include Numbers 35:6, 33; Deuteronomy 33:8-11; Hebrews 7:23-28, which point to the special status of the priestly tribe.

questions.question: Which city, formerly called Arba's city, was given to the children of Aaron and became a city of refuge?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:11-13 states that Hebron, formerly Arba’s city, was given to the children of Aaron and designated as a city of refuge. This highlights God's provision for justice and protection for those who unintentionally commit manslaughter, corresponding with Numbers 35:9-28 and Psalm 68:5. The concept of refuge foreshadows Christ as the ultimate refuge (John 10:28-29).

questions.question: From which tribes did the rest of the Kohathite Levites receive their allotted cities?
options: Ephraim, Dan, and half of Manasseh
questions.correctAnswer: Ephraim, Dan, and half of Manasseh
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:5, 20-26 describes that the Kohathites, excluding Aaron's descendants, received cities from the tribes of Ephraim, Dan, and half of Manasseh. This distribution reflects God's detailed ordering and care for the Levites, emphasizing His holiness and the separation of the priestly tribe from other Levites (Leviticus 10:10; Numbers 18). It also connects to the fulfillment of God's promises concerning tribal territories (Genesis 48:16).

questions.question: How many cities with suburbs were assigned to the children of Gershon?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:6, 27-33 records that the Gershonites received thirteen cities with their suburbs from the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and the other half of Manasseh. This allocation reflects God's faithfulness and the Levites' unique role in Israel's worship and community life (Numbers 3:21-26). The distribution also symbolizes God's provision for His servants among the people (Psalm 68:24).

questions.question: Which of the following tribes did NOT give cities to the children of Merari?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:7, 34-40 shows that the Merarites received twelve cities from the tribes of Zebulun, Reuben, and Gad. The tribe of Simeon is not mentioned as a donor for Merari, but rather for the priests (Joshua 21:9-16). This distinction illustrates the ordered manner of God's distribution and the special roles assigned to each Levite family (Numbers 3:36-37; 1 Chronicles 6:1-15).

questions.question: What was the total number of cities given to the Levites, including their suburbs?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:41-42 states that the Levites were given 48 cities with their suburbs throughout the inheritance of the tribes. This total reflects God's perfect provision for the Levites, ensuring their dwelling places across Israel, and underscores the fulfillment of His promises (Numbers 35:1-8; Deuteronomy 10:9). The number 48 symbolizes completeness in provision and the holiness of God's appointed servants.

questions.question: How does Joshua 21 illustrate God's faithfulness in fulfilling His promises to Israel?
options: All the promised land was possessed and rest given with no enemy standing before them
The Levites were given cities exactly as commanded by Moses
There was no failure of any good thing spoken by the LORD
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:43-45 summarizes that God gave Israel all the land He swore to give, gave them rest, and none of their enemies stood before them. Also, every good thing promised came to pass. This passage highlights God's unchanging faithfulness (Deuteronomy 7:9; Psalm 89:34; 2 Corinthians 1:20). It confirms the trustworthiness of God's covenant and serves as a type of the ultimate rest in Christ (Hebrews 4:1-11).

questions.question: Which city given to the Levites was designated as a city of refuge in the territory of Manasseh in Bashan?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:27 identifies Golan in Bashan, part of the half tribe of Manasseh, as a city of refuge given to the Gershonites. This designation shows God's provision for justice and mercy within the land (Numbers 35:9-15; Deuteronomy 19:1-13). The cities of refuge prefigure Christ as the ultimate protector and advocate for sinners (Hebrews 6:18).

questions.question: The Levites were given cities with suburbs for what specific purpose related to their livelihood?
options: To provide pasture for their cattle
questions.correctAnswer: To provide pasture for their cattle
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:2 and 21:3 state that the Levites were given cities with suburbs for their cattle. This provision highlights God's care for their needs and supports the sanctity of their priestly and Levitical service (Numbers 18:20-24). The suburbs enabled the Levites to sustain themselves without possessing tribal land, symbolizing their dependence on God's provision (Psalm 23:1-3).

questions.question: Which half tribe of Manasseh gave cities to both the Kohathites and Gershonites?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:5 and 21:27 reveal that the half tribe of Manasseh in Bashan (East Manasseh) gave cities to both Kohathites and Gershonites. This shows God's detailed and fair distribution of land, ensuring all Levite families had assigned dwelling places throughout Israel (Numbers 26:29-34). This order reflects God's sovereign and just governance (Psalm 89:14).

questions.question: What theological significance does the establishment of cities of refuge have in the broader biblical narrative?
options: They provide a place of mercy and protection for the unintentional slayer
They symbolize God's justice balanced with mercy
They foreshadow Christ as the ultimate refuge and mediator
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:13, 21, 32, 38 designates cities of refuge to provide protection for unintentional killers, illustrating God's justice and mercy (Numbers 35:9-28; Deuteronomy 19:1-13). Theologically, these cities foreshadow Christ who offers ultimate refuge and intercession (Hebrews 7:25; John 10:28-29). The city of refuge theme is foundational in understanding God's redemptive justice.

questions.question: Which tribe's territory did the Levites NOT receive cities from according to Joshua 21?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:1-42 describes cities given to Levites from other tribes’ inheritances; Levites themselves did not have a tribal territory. This reflects God's unique arrangement where the Levites are set apart for service and sustained by the other tribes (Numbers 18:20-24; Deuteronomy 18:1-2). This typifies the spiritual priesthood that Christ fulfills (1 Peter 2:9).

questions.question: Which Levite family received cities from the tribes of Issachar, Asher, and Naphtali?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:6, 28-33 records the Gershonites receiving thirteen cities from Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and half of Manasseh. This division among Levitical families shows God's orderly providence and the variety of service roles within His covenant community (Numbers 3:21-26; 1 Chronicles 6:16-28). It points to the diversity within unity in the body of Christ (1 Corinthians 12:12-27).

questions.question: What does Joshua 21 teach about God's covenant keeping nature?
options: God fulfills every promise made to His people
God provides rest and victory over enemies
God ensures His appointed servants are cared for
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:43-45 summarizes the fulfillment of God's promises, rest granted to Israel, and care for the Levites. This emphasizes God's unchanging faithfulness (Psalm 89:34; 2 Timothy 2:13), His providential care over His people (Romans 8:28), and the ultimate rest in Christ (Hebrews 4). These doctrines are central to biblical theology and Christian hope.

questions.question: Which city was given to the Merarites from the tribe of Gad and designated as a city of refuge?
questions.explanation: Joshua 21:38-39 states Ramoth in Gilead with suburbs was given to Merarites from Gad and was a city of refuge. This provision reflects God's care for justice and protection for His people (Numbers 35:6-7), and foreshadows Christ as the ultimate refuge (Psalm 46:1; Hebrews 6:18). It also shows the fulfillment of God's promises across tribal boundaries.

questions.question: What is the significance of the Levites not receiving a territorial inheritance but cities within other tribes' lands?
options: It shows their unique role as mediators and servants of God
It reflects God's provision without land ownership for the priestly tribe
It signifies their dependence on God and the community
questions.explanation: Joshua 21 and Numbers 18 explain that Levites received cities and pasture but no tribal land, emphasizing their special mediatory role (Deuteronomy 10:8-9). This arrangement teaches about holiness, dependence on God, and the typology of Christ as the ultimate mediator without earthly inheritance (Hebrews 7:24-28). It underscores God's sovereign provision for His servants.
